pullRequest.title: CORE: Removed all unused "status" columns
pullRequest.bodyText:
Changed "status" column to integer for "specific_user_users" table.
Fixed SQL working with "specific_user_users" table.
Removed all unused "status" columns of char(1) types from all tables.
Updated DB schema and test data to 3.1.64.

commit.message:
CORE: Removed all unused "status" columns

- Changed "status" column to integer for "specific_user_users" table.
- Fixed SQL working with "specific_user_users" table.
- Removed all unused "status" columns of char(1) types from all tables.
- Updated DB schema and test data to 3.1.64.

nodes.bodyText: This comment is misleading. Status in this table means 'enabled or disabled ownership'. Can you please change it here?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -423,11 +410,11 @@ create table specific_user_users (
 	modified_by_uid integer,
 	modified_at timestamp default current_date not null,
 	type longvarchar default 'service' not null,
-	status char(1) default '0' not null, --is it service user?
+	status integer default 0 not null, --is it service user?

commit.message:
CORE: Fixed comment in DB definition

- status column in specific_user_users means: 0=enabled or 1=disabled ownership.
